newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian sugar slips as fall in demand lifts sales.
newsitem.headline: Indian sugar slips as fall in demand lifts sales.

text.p: Sugar prices slid on the local market on Thursday on sluggish consumer buying and scattered enquiries from retailers, traders said.
Local millers were active sellers due to sluggish outstation buying, dealers said. Higher offerings by the millers has improved supplies of sugar from mills to the market, they said.
Ready delivery sugar S-30 fell by 10 rupees at 1,455/1,470 rupees per quintal while M-30 slid by 4/5 rupees at 1,480/1,524 rupees per quintal.
Mill delivery sugar S-30 fell five rupees at 1,385/1,400 rupees per quintal while M-30 moved down by 10 rupees at 1,400/1,425 rupees per quintal.
